qas.question: In degrees Fahrenheit, what was the highest temperature achieved in Plymouth between 1971 and 2000?
In what month and year did Plymouth see its highest temperature between 1971 and 2000?
About how many days a year in Plymouth are over 77 °F?
In degrees Celsius, what was the coldest temperature recorded at Plymouth between 1971 and 2000?
In what month and year did Plymouth see its lowest temperature between 1971 and 2000?

context: Typically, the warmest day of the year (1971–2000) will achieve a temperature of 26.6 °C (80 °F), although in <a1_0>June 1976<a1_0/> the temperature reached 31.6 °C (<a0_0>89<a0_0/> °F), the site record. On average, <a2_0>4.25<a2_0/> days of the year will report a maximum temperature of 25.1 °C (77 °F) or above. During the winter half of the year, the coldest night will typically fall to −4.1 °C (25 °F) although in <a4_0>January 1979<a4_0/> the temperature fell to <a3_0>−8.8 °C<a3_0/> (16 °F). Typically, 18.6 nights of the year will register an air frost.
